page.title: 09Employment in Glenisla.cont.
page.content: There are two pony-trekking centres in Glenisla which provide seasonal employment. These centres encourage people to come to the Glen and they in turn use the hotels' facilities thus enabling these establishments to remain open. Since job opportunities are limited, some people have to travel out of the Glen for work. Some women such as nurses and secretaries have to travel as jobs such as these are simply not available. Young people leaving school also find it necessary to go out of the Glen to seek employment and most do so. Farm mechanisation has, over the years, resulted in the need for fewer farm labourers. Population has therefore decreased and it seems unlikely that this trend will change. Fewer jobs equals fewer people.
